items.summary: RBA governor Michele Bullock has refused to blame the Albanese government for rising inflation, as a political fight breaks out in the wake of the bank's rate hike.

items.title: Man faces court charged with possessing extremist material after phone search at Brisbane Airport
items.summary: Police allege a 25-year-old man intercepted at Brisbane International Airport had violent extremist material on his phone, after an investigation into an alleged Nazi flag delivery to the man.

items.title: RecipeTin Eats' Nagi Maehashi is normalising taking time off for pets. Here's why that matters.
items.summary: Experts say our pets have become such an important part of our lives that it's important to take a step back from responsibilities, if possible, when they are sick or dying.

items.title: Australia's surging expectations at the Winter Olympics come thanks to Geoff Henke's strident advocacy
items.summary: Australia is hoping Milano Cortina 2026 will be its most successful Winter Olympics in history. The reason for Australia's winter sports surge has its roots in a 70-year-old snubbing.

items.title: French authorities sink tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, then release suspects
items.summary: French authorities intercept a ship carrying five tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, before releasing the vessel and its crew.

items.title: Questions raised over $93 million investment in WA school with 30 per cent attendance rate
items.summary: By the end of 2026 the WA government and Woodside will have spent over $93 million on Roebourne District High School and its 141 enrolled students. But last year only one in four upper school students attended.

items.title: Beyond the Songs Inside: After the applause
items.summary: Creative prison programs are celebrated for their ability to heal and transform incarcerated people. But are they enough to break the cycle?

items.title: Louvre releases photos of squashed crown abandoned by jewel heist gang
items.summary: The thieves who robbed the famed Paris museum last October dropped the diamond and emerald-studded crown as they escaped, leaving it crushed and broken.

items.title: Queensland Jewish leader wants stronger crackdown on symbols, flags, and slogans in wake of Bondi attack
items.summary: Queensland Jewish Board of Deputies president Jason Steinberg has called on the state government to ramp up anti-hate laws in the wake of last year's Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Pharmacy apologises after customers given wrong medicines, scripts in Broome

items.summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru pulled off the biggest successful chase in the Women's Premier League to win their second title in the Indian franchise-based T20 league.

items.title: Nationals counter Ley's offer with two-week frontbench exile — as it happened

items.summary: As One Nation announces its plan to open an office in Longreach, the ABC speaks to voters in David Littleproud's electorate to get their thoughts on the Nationals leader.

items.title: Late NSW tradie Brett Mckay connected with thousands by sharing cancer battle online

items.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia

items.title: US hopes to challenge China's critical minerals dominance with new trading bloc

items.title: Today in history, February 6: The Manchester United team that perished in the Munich air disaster of 1958
